course.subject: LIFS
course.name: Bioinformatics
course.description: An introduction to bioinformatic analysis in life science. Students will learn about the principles and approaches used in working with genetic, genomic and proteomic data. Applications to basic science and translational research will also be introduced. No experience in computer programing is required.

reviews.author: snsdforever1
reviews.comment_content:
Introduction to bioinformatics/Course overview
Tutorial: General software and tools in Life Science
Sequence alignment and searching 1
Tutorial: Alignment of unknown genetic sequences
Sequence alignment and searching 2
Tutorial: Identify unknown protein sequences
Human genetics and genetic disorders 1
Tutorial: Finding disease diagnosis from genetic data
Human genetics and genetic disorders 2
Tutorial: Analyzing genetic variants from GWAS
Epigenomics
Tutorial: Visualizing the epigenome
Crash course in Python
Tutorial: Applying python to study biology

Gene Expression Analysis (Array)
Tutorial: Microarray analysis
Next-Generation Sequencing (NGS)
Tutorial: NGS data processing and visualization
Motifs and Functional annotations
Tutorial: Motif identification and Functional annotations/enrichment of unknown sequences
Proteomics (Introduction)
Proteomics (Instrumentation)
Proteomics (Spectral Analysis)
Tutorial: Protein Identification Analysis
reviews.comment_teaching: Danny, Tom: detailed teaching with clear voice and good pace
reviews.comment_grading:
Fair absolute grading
Around 10% A range
Around 35% B range
Around 35% C range
remaining D/F range
reviews.comment_workload:
Mid-term test is replaced by one take-home assignment 47.5%
Final exam (3 hours) 47.5%
Attendance 5%

The assignment takes around one week to finish and is required to use some websites to finish it, but Danny would demonstrate how to use those websites during the lectures and teach us some skills through some exercises.
